meta_description.title: Developed games - Technos Japan Corp. - Giant Bomb
meta_description.text: Established in 1981, Technōs Japan is best known for creating the Double Dragon and Kunio-kun franchises. The company went out of business in 1996.

people_also_ask.heading: Technōs Japan's subsequent arcade beat-em-up, Double Dragon, was a big success worldwide when it was released in 1987, leading to the production of an NES version of the game, as well as licensed versions by other companies for various platforms. ... By 1996, Technōs Japan declared bankruptcy and ceased operations.

people_also_ask.heading: Technōs Japan
people_also_ask.heading2: River City Ransom, later released as Street Gangs in the PAL regions, is an open world action role-playing beat 'em up video game originally for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It was developed by Technōs Japan and originally released in Japan on April 25, 1989.

knowledge_panel.description: technōs japan corp. was a japanese video game developer, best known for the double dragon and kunio-kun franchises as well as karate champ and voltage fighter gowcaizer. as of june 2015, arc system works owns the intellectual properties of technōs japan. wikipedia
